headline: Why HP (HPQ) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of personal computing and printing company HP (NYSE:HPQ) fell 3.2% in the afternoon session after a report from Wedbush Securities identified the company as one of several potential "AI losers."

headline: Lenovo: Undervalued, But Surging Memory Prices Threaten Margins And End-User Demand
summary: Lenovo navigates rising DRAM costs with strategic actions while gaining PC and server market share. Read why LNVGY stock is a Buy.

headline: Time for (Selective) Caution in Tech. 3 Stocks With Bearish Charts.
summary: Several widely held tech stocks have failed to keep pace with the group’s rally, a divergence investors should treat with caution.  Not all software stocks are dropping, as standout performers  AppLovin MongoDB  and  CrowdStrike Holdings  have each rallied more than 20% over the last three months, highlighting how uneven the group has become.  One name that appears on shaky footing is  Veeva Systems  a cloud-based software company focused on healthcare.
